workflow.name: Auto-publish Facebook posts from Google Sheets with Slack & email alerts
workflow.description:
## üìä Description
Simplify your social media publishing process by automating post scheduling from Google Sheets directly to Meta (Facebook Pages). üìÖüí¨ This workflow detects pending posts, uploads images with captions to your Facebook Page, updates the sheet status, and sends real-time notifications via Slack and email ‚Äî keeping your marketing team always in sync. üöÄ

## What This Template Does
1Ô∏è‚É£ Trigger ‚Äì Monitors a Google Sheet for new or pending posts every minute. ‚è∞
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Filter ‚Äì Identifies the latest ‚Äúpending‚Äù entry for publishing. üîç
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Extract ‚Äì Captures post details like caption, image URL, and ID. üßæ
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Publish ‚Äì Uploads the post to your Meta (Facebook) Page using the Graph API. üì§
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Validate ‚Äì Confirms success or failure of the post operation. ‚úÖ
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Notify ‚Äì Sends instant Slack and email updates on publishing status. üíå
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Update ‚Äì Marks the published post as ‚ÄúCompleted‚Äù in Google Sheets. üìä

## Key Benefits
‚úÖ Hands-free publishing from Google Sheets to Meta
 ‚úÖ Instant Slack and email alerts for post outcomes
 ‚úÖ Prevents duplicate or failed post uploads
 ‚úÖ Centralized content tracking and status updates
 ‚úÖ Improves consistency and speed in social media operations

## Features
- Google Sheets trigger for post scheduling
- Facebook Graph API integration for auto-posting
- Slack and Outlook notifications for success/error alerts
- Automatic sheet updates post-publication
- Error handling and reporting for failed posts

## Requirements
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials
- Facebook Page Access Token via Graph API
- Slack Bot token for notifications
- Outlook or SMTP credentials for email updates
- Target Audience
- Marketing teams managing Facebook content calendars üìÜ
- Social media managers seeking automated posting üì£
- Agencies coordinating client content delivery üìã
- Teams tracking campaign publishing performance üìä

workflow.name: Auto-Publish Meta Posts from Google Sheets with Slack & Email Alerts

parameters.content:
## üìã Auto-Publish Meta Posts

### How it works
This workflow automatically posts new content from a Google Sheet to your Facebook Page and notifies your team when it succeeds or fails. It checks the sheet every minute for rows marked ‚Äúpending.‚Äù When one is found, it extracts the caption and image URL, posts to Facebook via the Graph API, and then sends Slack and email notifications. The workflow also updates the Google Sheet status to ‚ÄúCompleted‚Äù once a post is published, keeping everything organized and preventing duplicates.

### Setup steps
1. Connect your Google Sheets, Facebook Graph API, Slack, and Email (SMTP or Outlook) credentials.
2. In Google Sheets, create a table with columns: `post_id`, `caption`, `image_url`, and `status`.
3. Enter one or more pending posts with `status = pending`.
4. Configure your Facebook Page ID and access token (use credentials, not hard-coded tokens).
5. Adjust Slack channel, email addresses, or poll frequency if needed.
6. Run once manually to verify posting works end-to-end.
7. Once verified, enable the workflow ‚Äî it will publish automatically whenever new rows appear.

## Input & Filtering 


Checks the Google Sheet every minute and filters for rows where `status = pending`. 
The Code node ensures only the latest pending row is used. 
Then the data is extracted for posting (caption + image URL).

## Meta Publishing 


Publishes the image and caption to your Facebook Page using the Graph API. 
After posting, the IF node checks if a valid Post ID exists to confirm success before continuing.

## Success Notifications & Sheet Update 


If the post succeeds, sends a Slack and Outlook/Email confirmation with caption, image, and post ID. 
Finally, updates the Google Sheet to mark the post as ‚ÄúCompleted.‚Äù

## Error Handling 


If posting fails, sends a Slack and email alert containing the error message, caption, and image URL. 
Helps you quickly spot and fix issues with credentials or image links.

üïí Posted via n8n automation workflow.

With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
